    public class DefaultExitCondition
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExitCondition
    The default exit condition used by the loop unit.

      • isExitLoop

        public boolean isExitLoop(java.lang.Object[] data)
                   throws InvalidEquationException
        Calculates whether the loop should exit. This decision can be based on a any factors, including the parameters of the loop task and other tasks.
        Specified by:
        isExitLoop in interface ExitCondition
        Returns:
        true if the loop should exit
        Throws:
        InvalidEquationException

      • getParameter

        public java.lang.Object getParameter(java.lang.String paramname)
                              throws InvalidEquationException
        Returns:
        the specified parameter value, where paramname is a mapped paramname or of the form groupname.taskname.paramname (returns null if parameter not set). Note that if the paramname is mapped to multiple parameters then the value of one is returned (but it is not defined which one!).
        Throws:
        InvalidEquationException
